text: Hi <@U03SPJUT665> - you can manage duplicated contacts in HS UI, but with API, you'll have to create a logic to index those duplicated contacts and then merge them with this endpoint <https://legacydocs.HubSpot.com/docs/methods/contacts/merge-contacts> or delete one of them. But merge is a better option.
Hi <@U042SDKQBE3> - present them on the website page from HubSpot or on the WP or any other CMS?
Hi <@U01ASFZL4UA> thank you for the assistance. I'll definitely check into this.

We have a 3rd party system that also receives the emails that are arriving in a conversation inbox. The 3rd party system needs to close a conversation once the email has been actioned.

Is there a way to use the API, knowing the email ID / message ID to get the Thread ID it is associated to?

HI!

Welcome! What is your question? What have you tried to do to make it work? What is the problem you are having?

The questions people ask that go through their troubleshooting process and ask a question generally get the most attention because the person has put enough information in here. Your current question just sounds like you are looking for someone to feel sorry for you.

I found your question:
`On deals object there is default field called "company currency", is it possible to update it's value daily using API? or internal workflow?`

I just went into a deal and wasn’t able to find that property.

<https://share.getcloudapp.com/d5un1Bvq>

I’d go here: <https://app.HubSpot.com/property-settings/6534445/properties?type=0-3> to your deal properties, look up the property you are looking to update, edit the property and look at the <https://share.getcloudapp.com/ApuDYQLj|internal name> by clicking the </> button

Now, find yourself a deal to update, then use the api, and update that deal property

Hello HubSpot Team,

I am writing to you from across the desk at Salesforce. Hope you are all doing well.

I have a mutual customer that uses Salesforce CRM and HubSpot Marketing. They have an immediate requirement to integrate our two platforms :) I am running into a wall understanding what the Salesforce requirements are to allow for this. For e.g <https://knowledge.HubSpot.com/salesforce/install-the-HubSpot-salesforce-integration> its says you need any Salesforce edition with an API enabled or Salesforce professional however Salesforce professional does not come with API access as standard. There is an ability to add on ‘web services API’ to professional but im not sure if this will allow the bi-drectional integration? Could someone help me out as I understand HubSpot manage the connector here. Thanks so much

from my understanding, this sounds like you are asking about your salesforce account limitation?

You need api access to be able to read from or write to salesforce.

My advice — create an inclusion list of a few test records. Some of them exist in both platforms, some of them don’t.

Make sure you use the inclusion list for syncing. Then go turn on the sync. See what happens. If it gives you errors on the most basic of setup, then you might have a salesforce api issue. If it works, then the api isn’t an issue

Agreed with <@U25PYL3Q8>,
The HubSpot to Salesforce connector relies on the ability to make API calls to pass information back and forth between both systems.

If you don't have access to the API, it's very unlikely this will work.

thanks so much for the reply <@U25PYL3Q8> <@U02JH23B6T1> i really appreciate it.  In the documentation it says  you need “A <https://help.salesforce.com/articleView?id=000005140&type=1|Salesforce edition with API access>” .. I suppose my question is really whether the web services api that can be bolted on with sf profesional edition is enough to facilitate the HubSpot integration .. thanks all

I found this by doing a google search on “does my professional edition have api access in salesforce” —
<https://success.mixmax.com/article/170-salesforce-plan-api-access>

The other articles in the search talk about reaching out to your account executive.
you could use the search endpoint to get that a bit more pinned down, *crm/v3/objects/notes/search, but it has a limit of 4 requests per second*
Awesome, I'll take a look, thank you sir <@U25PYL3Q8> :saluting_face:
From all the documentation I see you need a threadId before you can call a single message ID. <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/conversations/conversations>

Hello everyone,
I am planing on developing a interface between an ERP system and HubSpot and I am wondering how to setup the connected app.
I want to create a connected app like Salesforce where I can activate the sync or edit the mapping. The connected app that I created dont have features like that.
Am I choosing the wrong app or is it not possible to achive my goal with the standard HubSpot apps.
Thanks in advance!
That seems like a pretty cool project. What ERP are you syncing?
<@U01QVR44MEY> Sage100
Ah, ok I don't think HubSpot currently allows for building a custom sync like this: <https://www.HubSpot.com/hubfs/operations-hub-data-sync-hero-screenshot.png>
But I've always just built oauth apps and have setup HubSpot event subscriptions through the webhooks api <https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/webhooks>
You can do the same thing with Sage <https://developer.sage.com/api/people/guides/webhooks/>
Then you need to setup a server that can use this data to update the opposite system
Im planing on developing an service which is hosted on my server. The mapping should preferebly be within HubSpot since its the system that I use most and I dont want to hardcode it.
CC <@U01JT537HG9> can this type of functionality can be used by marketplace apps yet?
I’m afraid not - data sync is still sitting intimately on HubSpot’s infrastructure right now and we can’t yet make that an “SDK” or anything like that
That's kinda what I thought
Thats unfortunate.. so I have to implement my mapping in Sage or somehow different. Thanks for your help! <@U01QVR44MEY> <@U01JT537HG9>

so we have used this API: POST*`/crm/v3/objects/emails/search`* 
From this we have the message ID, we then want to figure out which thread it belongs to. I was wondering if there was an email message call that would give more verbose information.

Hello Everyone,
Are we able to get/put/post/fetch dummy blog data to/from HubSpot?
Thanks!

There are couple of ERP syncs in the HubSpot marketplace, take a look at how they've approached it.   I am building one for NetSuite. Let me know if you have any questions. All of them are a beast :slightly_smiling_face:

Hi! Ive posted this <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/APIs-Integrations/Can-I-test-pushing-data-to-HubSpot-on-sandbox-account-vs/td-p/696936|question> in HubSpot community, but figure id try asking here. In past when developing pipeline that pushed data to HubSpot via API, i had to create an app developer account and test account in order to test outside of our production HubSpot account. I then had to manually copy over objects, properties, etc. from the prod account into the test account (not a small lift).

There are now "sandbox" accounts which the docs say can be used for testing certain integrations. It appears that these sandbox account have automatic syncing for certain objects in the corresponding production account. There are now other developers on my team who are planning to test pushing data to HubSpot via API using one of these "sandbox" account. They are hoping to leverage this because of the fact that there are objects synced from prod and they dont have to go through the heavy lift of creating mirrored objects in the sandbox account. Is this doable? I have seen multiple community questions that _seem_ to suggest we should be using the developer/test account INSTEAD of the "sandbox" account for this type of testing (example <https://community.HubSpot.com/t5/APIs-Integrations/Difference-between-sandbox-and-testing-account/td-p/582804|here>). But i dont see anything in official docs that makes this clear. Can we use a HubSpot "sandbox" account to test API integration pushing data to HubSpot?

<https://developers.HubSpot.com/docs/api/account-types>
